item.title: NASA’s Mars Spacecraft Capture Images of Comet 3I/ATLAS
item.description: Two orbiters and a rover captured images of the interstellar object — from the closest location any of the agency’s spacecraft may get — that could reveal new details.

item.title: NASA, European Partners Set to Launch Sentinel-6B Earth Satellite
item.description: Set to track sea levels across more than 90% of Earth’s ocean, the mission must first get into orbit. Here’s what to expect.

item.title: 6 Things to Know From NASA About New US, European Sea Satellite
item.description: Data from Sentinel-6B will continue a decades-long record of sea surface height, helping to improve coastal planning, protect critical infrastructure, and advance weather forecasts.

item.title: NASA-ISRO Satellite Lifts Off to Track Earth’s Changing Surfaces
item.description: The first-of-its kind satellite will provide actionable information in a range of areas, including disaster response, infrastructure monitoring, and agricultural management.

item.title: October 2025 Company Update
item.description: As Terran R development continues to advance, we’re excited to share updates from October across design, build, test, and launch. item.title: September 2025 Company Update
item.description: The Terran R program continues to build momentum, and September delivered meaningful progress across design, manufacturing, testing, and launch. item.title: August 2025 Company Update
item.description: Throughout August, the Terran R program continued to make measurable progress toward first launch, delivering on critical program milestones. Design This month, the team completed 18 component-level Critical Design Reviews (CDRs), most of which focused on the second stage engine and fluids system
